messages.message: Hi, I know this is behind a feature flag at the moment. But quick clean and clean with prompt seems to be available if youâ€™re a community user. Is this intended?
p.s. the quick clean and prompt clean functions works really well in my testing :fire:
I believe only custom function is restricted to commercial users, so yes this seems expected
Thanks! @Bastiane @hannah it would be good to discuss if we should gate this to Commercial
btw it's internal opt-in because when running it as an app there are still some issues that we were working on before the 23.47 codecut; refinement is set to be GA in 23.49
demo it within build should be fine
@Kerry Seems to work great in my testing! Are all the feature flags in the settings screen for intenal only?
it's internal opt-in also, as in internal users can always switch off. internal users are users with an instsabase.com email
(i.e. which features are GA for customers, vs behind a feature flag etc vs internal only etc)
Good call, we can have a clearer view on that; all GA features in are the docs and release notes, but I don't think we have a place that write down GA vs internal features
I can maybe create a quick table
Thanks! Let me know how we can help. The Sales team are frequently confused on what the 'current' answer is given we're moving so fast!
i can work with @Bastiane @hannah on this

This is intended: currently only advanced refinement (UDF) is a commercial gated feature. @Tom let's discuss if you think we should also gate prompt-based refinement. I also marked all commercial only features on the roadmap doc (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xoYXJSNzBD4oBzZx-6IauprHh--T59FIFhgqYH3us9w/edit). And our tiering page on the website will also be updated once features are GA. @aristo @Bas
We are planning to include roadmap information in our internal bi-weekly release update. cc @Josh Heidebrecht Will follow up with @Kerry on the internal release process and communication.
